element.name: Segment
element.documentation: The Root Element that contains all other Top-Level Elements (Elements defined only at Level 1). A Matroska file is composed of 1 Segment.

element.name: SeekHead
element.documentation: Contains the Segment Position of other Top-Level Elements.

element.name: Seek
element.documentation: Contains a single seek entry to an EBML Element.

element.name: SeekID
element.documentation: The binary ID corresponding to the Element name.

element.name: SeekPosition
element.documentation: The Segment Position of the Element.

element.name: Info
element.documentation: Contains general information about the Segment.

element.name: SegmentUID
element.documentation: A randomly generated unique ID to identify the Segment amongst many others (128 bits).
If the Segment is a part of a Linked Segment, then this Element is **REQUIRED**.

element.name: SegmentFilename
element.documentation: A filename corresponding to this Segment.

element.name: PrevUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the previous Segment of a Linked Segment (128 bits).

If the Segment is a part of a Linked Segment that uses Hard Linking, then either the PrevUID or the NextUID Element is **REQUIRED**. If a Segment contains a PrevUID but not a NextUID, then it **MAY** be considered as the last Segment of the Linked Segment. The PrevUID **MUST NOT** be equal to the SegmentUID.

element.name: PrevFilename
element.documentation: A filename corresponding to the file of the previous Linked Segment.
Provision of the previous filename is for display convenience, but PrevUID **SHOULD** be considered authoritative for identifying the previous Segment in a Linked Segment.

element.name: NextUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the next Segment of a Linked Segment (128 bits).

If the Segment is a part of a Linked Segment that uses Hard Linking, then either the PrevUID or the NextUID Element is **REQUIRED**. If a Segment contains a NextUID but not a PrevUID, then it **MAY** be considered as the first Segment of the Linked Segment. The NextUID **MUST NOT** be equal to the SegmentUID.

element.name: NextFilename
element.documentation: A filename corresponding to the file of the next Linked Segment.
Provision of the next filename is for display convenience, but NextUID **SHOULD** be considered authoritative for identifying the Next Segment.

element.name: SegmentFamily
element.documentation: A randomly generated unique ID that all Segments of a Linked Segment **MUST** share (128 bits).
If the Segment Info contains a `ChapterTranslate` element, this Element is **REQUIRED**.

element.name: ChapterTranslate
element.documentation: The mapping between this `Segment` and a segment value in the given Chapter Codec.

Chapter Codec may need to address different segments, but they may not know of the way to identify such segment when stored in Matroska. This element and its child elements add a way to map the internal segments known to the Chapter Codec to the Segment IDs in Matroska. This allows remuxing a file with Chapter Codec without changing the content of the codec data, just the Segment mapping.

element.name: ChapterTranslateID
element.documentation: The binary value used to represent this Segment in the chapter codec data. The format depends on the ChapProcessCodecID used; see (#chapprocesscodecid-element).

element.name: ChapterTranslateCodec
element.documentation: This `ChapterTranslate` applies to this chapter codec of the given chapter edition(s); see (#chapprocesscodecid-element).

enum.label: Matroska Script
enum.documentation: Chapter commands using the Matroska Script codec.

enum.label: DVD-menu
enum.documentation: Chapter commands using the DVD-like codec.

element.name: ChapterTranslateEditionUID
element.documentation: Specify a chapter edition UID on which this `ChapterTranslate` applies.
When no `ChapterTranslateEditionUID` is specified in the `ChapterTranslate`, the `ChapterTranslate` applied to all chapter editions found in the Segment using the given `ChapterTranslateCodec`.

element.name: TimestampScale
element.documentation: Timestamp scale in nanoseconds (1.000.000 means all timestamps in the Segment are expressed in milliseconds).

element.name: Duration
element.documentation: Duration of the Segment in nanoseconds based on TimestampScale.

element.name: DateUTC
element.documentation: The date and time that the Segment was created by the muxing application or library.

element.name: Title
element.documentation: General name of the Segment.

element.name: MuxingApp
element.documentation: Muxing application or library (example: "libmatroska-0.4.3").
Include the full name of the application or library followed by the version number.

element.name: WritingApp
element.documentation: Writing application (example: "mkvmerge-0.3.3").
Include the full name of the application followed by the version number.

element.name: Cluster
element.documentation: The Top-Level Element containing the (monolithic) Block structure.

element.name: Timestamp
element.documentation: Absolute timestamp of the cluster (based on TimestampScale).
This element **SHOULD** be the first child element of the Cluster it belongs to, or the second if that Cluster contains a CRC-32 element ((#crc-32)).

element.name: SilentTracks
element.documentation: The list of tracks that are not used in that part of the stream. It is useful when using overlay tracks on seeking or to decide what track to use.

element.name: SilentTrackNumber
element.documentation: One of the track number that are not used from now on in the stream. It could change later if not specified as silent in a further Cluster.

element.name: Position
element.documentation: The Segment Position of the Cluster in the Segment (0 in live streams). It might help to resynchronise offset on damaged streams.

element.name: PrevSize
element.documentation: Size of the previous Cluster, in octets. Can be useful for backward playing.

element.name: SimpleBlock
element.documentation: Similar to Block, see (#block-structure), but without all the extra information, mostly used to reduced overhead when no extra feature is needed; see (#simpleblock-structure) on SimpleBlock Structure.

element.name: BlockGroup
element.documentation: Basic container of information containing a single Block and information specific to that Block.

element.name: Block
element.documentation: Block containing the actual data to be rendered and a timestamp relative to the Cluster Timestamp; see (#block-structure) on Block Structure.

element.name: BlockVirtual
element.documentation: A Block with no data. It **MUST** be stored in the stream at the place the real Block would be in display order.

element.name: BlockAdditions
element.documentation: Contain additional blocks to complete the main one. An EBML parser that has no knowledge of the Block structure could still see and use/skip these data.

element.name: BlockMore
element.documentation: Contain the BlockAdditional and some parameters.

element.name: BlockAddID
element.documentation: An ID to identify the BlockAdditional level. If BlockAddIDType of the corresponding block is 0, this value is also the value of BlockAddIDType for the meaning of the content of BlockAdditional.

element.name: BlockAdditional
element.documentation: Interpreted by the codec as it wishes (using the BlockAddID).

element.name: BlockDuration
element.documentation: The duration of the Block (based on TimestampScale). The BlockDuration Element can be useful at the end of a Track to define the duration of the last frame (as there is no subsequent Block available), or when there is a break in a track like for subtitle tracks.
element.implementation_note: BlockDuration **MUST** be set (minOccurs=1) if the associated TrackEntry stores a DefaultDuration value.
When not written and with no DefaultDuration, the value is assumed to be the difference between the timestamp of this Block and the timestamp of the next Block in "display" order (not coding order).

element.name: ReferencePriority
element.documentation: This frame is referenced and has the specified cache priority. In cache only a frame of the same or higher priority can replace this frame. A value of 0 means the frame is not referenced.

element.name: ReferenceBlock
element.documentation:
A timestamp value, relative to the timestamp of the Block in this BlockGroup. This is used to reference other frames necessary to decode this frame. The relative value **SHOULD** correspond to a valid `Block` this `Block` depends on. Historically Matroska Writer didn't write the actual `Block(s)` this `Block` depends on, but *some* `Block` in the past.
The value "0" **MAY** also be used to signify this `Block` cannot be decoded on its own, but without knownledge of which `Block` is necessary. In this case, other `ReferenceBlock` **MUST NOT** be found in the same `BlockGroup`.
If the `BlockGroup` doesn't have any `ReferenceBlock` element, then the `Block` it contains can be decoded without using any other `Block` data.

element.name: ReferenceVirtual
element.documentation: The Segment Position of the data that would otherwise be in position of the virtual block.

element.name: CodecState
element.documentation: The new codec state to use. Data interpretation is private to the codec. This information **SHOULD** always be referenced by a seek entry.

element.name: DiscardPadding
element.documentation: Duration in nanoseconds of the silent data added to the Block (padding at the end of the Block for positive value, at the beginning of the Block for negative value). The duration of DiscardPadding is not calculated in the duration of the TrackEntry and **SHOULD** be discarded during playback.

element.name: Slices
element.documentation: Contains slices description.

element.name: TimeSlice
element.documentation: Contains extra time information about the data contained in the Block. Being able to interpret this Element is not **REQUIRED** for playback.

element.name: LaceNumber
element.documentation: The reverse number of the frame in the lace (0 is the last frame, 1 is the next to last, etc). Being able to interpret this Element is not **REQUIRED** for playback.

element.name: FrameNumber
element.documentation: The number of the frame to generate from this lace with this delay (allow you to generate many frames from the same Block/Frame).

element.name: BlockAdditionID
element.documentation: The ID of the BlockAdditional Element (0 is the main Block).

element.name: Delay
element.documentation: The (scaled) delay to apply to the Element.

element.name: SliceDuration
element.documentation: The (scaled) duration to apply to the Element.

element.name: ReferenceFrame
element.documentation: Contains information about the last reference frame. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: ReferenceOffset
element.documentation: The relative offset, in bytes, from the previous BlockGroup element for this Smooth FF/RW video track to the containing BlockGroup element. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: ReferenceTimestamp
element.documentation: The timecode of the BlockGroup pointed to by ReferenceOffset. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: EncryptedBlock
element.documentation: Similar to SimpleBlock, see (#simpleblock-structure), but the data inside the Block are Transformed (encrypt and/or signed).

element.name: Tracks
element.documentation: A Top-Level Element of information with many tracks described.

element.name: TrackEntry
element.documentation: Describes a track with all Elements.

element.name: TrackNumber
element.documentation: The track number as used in the Block Header (using more than 127 tracks is not encouraged, though the design allows an unlimited number).

element.name: TrackUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Track.

element.name: TrackType
element.documentation: The `TrackType` defines the type of each frame found in the Track. The value **SHOULD** be stored on 1 octet.

enum.label: video
enum.documentation: An image.

enum.label: audio
enum.documentation: Audio samples.

enum.label: complex
enum.documentation: A mix of different other TrackType. The codec needs to define how the `Matroska Player` should interpret such data.

enum.label: logo
enum.documentation: An image to be rendered over the video track(s).

enum.label: subtitle
enum.documentation: Subtitle or closed caption data to be rendered over the video track(s).

enum.label: buttons
enum.documentation: Interactive button(s) to be rendered over the video track(s).

enum.label: control
enum.documentation: Metadata used to control the player of the `Matroska Player`.

enum.label: metadata
enum.documentation: Timed metadata that can be passed on to the `Matroska Player`.

element.name: FlagEnabled
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the track is usable. It is possible to turn a not usable track into a usable track using chapter codecs or control tracks.

element.name: FlagDefault
element.documentation: Set if that track (audio, video or subs) **SHOULD** be eligible for automatic selection by the player; see (#default-track-selection) for more details.

element.name: FlagForced
element.documentation: Applies only to subtitles. Set if that track **SHOULD** be eligible for automatic selection by the player if it matches the user's language preference, even if the user's preferences would normally not enable subtitles with the selected audio track; this can be used for tracks containing only translations of foreign-language audio or onscreen text. See (#default-track-selection) for more details.

element.name: FlagHearingImpaired
element.documentation: Set to 1 if that track is suitable for users with hearing impairments, set to 0 if it is unsuitable for users with hearing impairments.

element.name: FlagVisualImpaired
element.documentation: Set to 1 if that track is suitable for users with visual impairments, set to 0 if it is unsuitable for users with visual impairments.

element.name: FlagTextDescriptions
element.documentation: Set to 1 if that track contains textual descriptions of video content, set to 0 if that track does not contain textual descriptions of video content.

element.name: FlagOriginal
element.documentation: Set to 1 if that track is in the content's original language, set to 0 if it is a translation.

element.name: FlagCommentary
element.documentation: Set to 1 if that track contains commentary, set to 0 if it does not contain commentary.

element.name: FlagLacing
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the track **MAY** contain blocks using lacing. When set to 0 all blocks **MUST** have their lacing flags set to No lacing; see (#block-lacing) on Block Lacing.

element.name: MinCache
element.documentation: The minimum number of frames a player **SHOULD** be able to cache during playback. If set to 0, the reference pseudo-cache system is not used.

element.name: MaxCache
element.documentation: The maximum cache size necessary to store referenced frames in and the current frame. 0 means no cache is needed.

element.name: DefaultDuration
element.documentation: Number of nanoseconds (not scaled via TimestampScale) per frame (frame in the Matroska sense -- one Element put into a (Simple)Block).

element.name: DefaultDecodedFieldDuration
element.documentation: The period in nanoseconds (not scaled by TimestampScale) between two successive fields at the output of the decoding process, see (#defaultdecodedfieldduration) for more information

element.name: TrackTimestampScale
element.documentation: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE. The scale to apply on this track to work at normal speed in relation with other tracks (mostly used to adjust video speed when the audio length differs).

element.name: TrackOffset
element.documentation: A value to add to the Block's Timestamp. This can be used to adjust the playback offset of a track.

element.name: MaxBlockAdditionID
element.documentation: The maximum value of BlockAddID ((#blockaddid-element)). A value 0 means there is no BlockAdditions ((#blockadditions-element)) for this track.

element.name: BlockAdditionMapping
element.documentation: Contains elements that extend the track format, by adding content either to each frame, with BlockAddID ((#blockaddid-element)), or to the track as a whole with BlockAddIDExtraData.

element.name: BlockAddIDValue
element.documentation: If the track format extension needs content beside frames, the value refers to the BlockAddID ((#blockaddid-element)), value being described. To keep MaxBlockAdditionID as low as possible, small values **SHOULD** be used.

element.name: BlockAddIDName
element.documentation: A human-friendly name describing the type of BlockAdditional data, as defined by the associated Block Additional Mapping.

element.name: BlockAddIDType
element.documentation: Stores the registered identifier of the Block Additional Mapping to define how the BlockAdditional data should be handled.

element.name: BlockAddIDExtraData
element.documentation: Extra binary data that the BlockAddIDType can use to interpret the BlockAdditional data. The interpretation of the binary data depends on the BlockAddIDType value and the corresponding Block Additional Mapping.

element.name: Name
element.documentation: A human-readable track name.

element.name: Language
LanguageIETF
element.documentation: Specifies the language of the track according to [@!BCP47] and using the IANA Language Subtag Registry [@!IANALangRegistry]. If this Element is used, then any Language Elements used in the same TrackEntry **MUST** be ignored.

element.name: CodecID
element.documentation: An ID corresponding to the codec, see [@!MatroskaCodec] for more info.

element.name: CodecPrivate
element.documentation: Private data only known to the codec.

element.name: CodecName
element.documentation: A human-readable string specifying the codec.

element.name: AttachmentLink
element.documentation: The UID of an attachment that is used by this codec.
The value **MUST** match the `FileUID` value of an attachment found in this Segment.

element.name: CodecSettings
element.documentation: A string describing the encoding setting used.

element.name: CodecInfoURL
element.documentation: A URL to find information about the codec used.

element.name: CodecDownloadURL
element.documentation: A URL to download about the codec used.

element.name: CodecDecodeAll
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the codec can decode potentially damaged data.

element.name: TrackOverlay
element.documentation: Specify that this track is an overlay track for the Track specified (in the u-integer). That means when this track has a gap, see (#silenttracks-element) on SilentTracks, the overlay track **SHOULD** be used instead. The order of multiple TrackOverlay matters, the first one is the one that **SHOULD** be used. If not found it **SHOULD** be the second, etc.

element.name: CodecDelay
element.documentation: CodecDelay is The codec-built-in delay in nanoseconds. This value **MUST** be subtracted from each block timestamp in order to get the actual timestamp. The value **SHOULD** be small so the muxing of tracks with the same actual timestamp are in the same Cluster.

element.name: SeekPreRoll
element.documentation: After a discontinuity, SeekPreRoll is the duration in nanoseconds of the data the decoder **MUST** decode before the decoded data is valid.

element.name: TrackTranslate
element.documentation: The mapping between this `TrackEntry` and a track value in the given Chapter Codec.

Chapter Codec may need to address content in specific track, but they may not know of the way to identify tracks in Matroska. This element and its child elements add a way to map the internal tracks known to the Chapter Codec to the track IDs in Matroska. This allows remuxing a file with Chapter Codec without changing the content of the codec data, just the track mapping.

element.name: TrackTranslateTrackID
element.documentation: The binary value used to represent this `TrackEntry` in the chapter codec data. The format depends on the `ChapProcessCodecID` used; see (#chapprocesscodecid-element).

element.name: TrackTranslateCodec
element.documentation: This `TrackTranslate` applies to this chapter codec of the given chapter edition(s); see (#chapprocesscodecid-element).

enum.label: Matroska Script
enum.documentation: Chapter commands using the Matroska Script codec.

enum.label: DVD-menu
enum.documentation: Chapter commands using the DVD-like codec.

element.name: TrackTranslateEditionUID
element.documentation: Specify a chapter edition UID on which this `TrackTranslate` applies.
When no `TrackTranslateEditionUID` is specified in the `TrackTranslate`, the `TrackTranslate` applies to all chapter editions found in the Segment using the given `TrackTranslateCodec`.

element.name: Video
element.documentation: Video settings.

element.name: FlagInterlaced
element.documentation: Specify whether the video frames in this track are interlaced or not.

enum.label: undetermined
enum.documentation: Unknown status.
This value **SHOULD** be avoided.

enum.label: interlaced
enum.documentation: Interlaced frames.

enum.label: progressive
enum.documentation: No interlacing.

element.name: FieldOrder
element.documentation: Specify the field ordering of video frames in this track.
If FlagInterlaced is not set to 1, this Element **MUST** be ignored.

enum.label: progressive
enum.documentation: Interlaced frames.
This value **SHOULD** be avoided, setting FlagInterlaced to 2 is sufficient.

enum.label: tff
enum.documentation: Top field displayed first. Top field stored first.

enum.label: undetermined
enum.documentation: Unknown field order.
This value **SHOULD** be avoided.

enum.label: bff
enum.documentation: Bottom field displayed first. Bottom field stored first.

enum.label: bff(swapped)
enum.documentation: Top field displayed first. Fields are interleaved in storage with the top line of the top field stored first.

enum.label: tff(swapped)
enum.documentation: Bottom field displayed first. Fields are interleaved in storage with the top line of the top field stored first.

element.name: StereoMode
element.documentation: Stereo-3D video mode. There are some more details in (#multi-planar-and-3d-videos).

enum.label: both eyes laced in one Block (left eye is first)
both eyes laced in one Block (right eye is first)

element.name: AlphaMode
element.documentation: Alpha Video Mode. Presence of this Element indicates that the BlockAdditional Element could contain Alpha data.

element.name: OldStereoMode
element.documentation: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE. Bogus StereoMode value used in old versions of libmatroska.

element.name: PixelWidth
element.documentation: Width of the encoded video frames in pixels.

element.name: PixelHeight
element.documentation: Height of the encoded video frames in pixels.

element.name: PixelCropBottom
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove at the bottom of the image.

element.name: PixelCropTop
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove at the top of the image.

element.name: PixelCropLeft
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove on the left of the image.

element.name: PixelCropRight
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove on the right of the image.

element.name: DisplayWidth
element.documentation: Width of the video frames to display. Applies to the video frame after cropping (PixelCrop* Elements).
element.implementation_note: If the DisplayUnit of the same TrackEntry is 0, then the default value for DisplayWidth is equal to PixelWidth - PixelCropLeft - PixelCropRight, else there is no default value.

element.name: DisplayHeight
element.documentation: Height of the video frames to display. Applies to the video frame after cropping (PixelCrop* Elements).
element.implementation_note: If the DisplayUnit of the same TrackEntry is 0, then the default value for DisplayHeight is equal to PixelHeight - PixelCropTop - PixelCropBottom, else there is no default value.

element.name: DisplayUnit
element.documentation: How DisplayWidth & DisplayHeight are interpreted.

element.name: AspectRatioType
element.documentation: Specify the possible modifications to the aspect ratio.

element.name: UncompressedFourCC
element.documentation: Specify the uncompressed pixel format used for the Track's data as a FourCC. This value is similar in scope to the biCompression value of AVI's `BITMAPINFO` [@?AVIFormat]. See the YUV video formats [@?FourCC-YUV] and RGB video formats [@?FourCC-RGB] for common values.
element.implementation_note: UncompressedFourCC **MUST** be set (minOccurs=1) in TrackEntry, when the CodecID Element of the TrackEntry is set to "V_UNCOMPRESSED".
element.documentation: This Element **MUST NOT** be used if the CodecID Element of the TrackEntry is set to "V_UNCOMPRESSED".

element.name: GammaValue
element.documentation: Gamma Value.

element.name: FrameRate
element.documentation: Number of frames per second. This value is Informational only. It is intended for constant frame rate streams, and **SHOULD NOT** be used for a variable frame rate TrackEntry.

element.name: Colour
element.documentation: Settings describing the colour format.

element.name: MatrixCoefficients
element.documentation: The Matrix Coefficients of the video used to derive luma and chroma values from red, green, and blue color primaries. For clarity, the value and meanings for MatrixCoefficients are adopted from Table 4 of ISO/IEC 23001-8:2016 or ITU-T H.273.

element.name: BitsPerChannel
element.documentation: Number of decoded bits per channel. A value of 0 indicates that the BitsPerChannel is unspecified.

element.name: ChromaSubsamplingHorz
element.documentation: The amount of pixels to remove in the Cr and Cb channels for every pixel not removed horizontally. Example: For video with 4:2:0 chroma subsampling, the ChromaSubsamplingHorz **SHOULD** be set to 1.

element.name: ChromaSubsamplingVert
element.documentation: The amount of pixels to remove in the Cr and Cb channels for every pixel not removed vertically. Example: For video with 4:2:0 chroma subsampling, the ChromaSubsamplingVert **SHOULD** be set to 1.

element.name: CbSubsamplingHorz
element.documentation: The amount of pixels to remove in the Cb channel for every pixel not removed horizontally. This is additive with ChromaSubsamplingHorz. Example: For video with 4:2:1 chroma subsampling, the ChromaSubsamplingHorz **SHOULD** be set to 1 and CbSubsamplingHorz **SHOULD** be set to 1.

element.name: CbSubsamplingVert
element.documentation: The amount of pixels to remove in the Cb channel for every pixel not removed vertically. This is additive with ChromaSubsamplingVert.

element.name: ChromaSitingHorz
element.documentation: How chroma is subsampled horizontally.

element.name: ChromaSitingVert
element.documentation: How chroma is subsampled vertically.

element.name: Range
element.documentation: Clipping of the color ranges.

element.name: TransferCharacteristics
element.documentation: The transfer characteristics of the video. For clarity, the value and meanings for TransferCharacteristics are adopted from Table 3 of ISO/IEC 23091-4 or ITU-T H.273.

element.name: Primaries
element.documentation: The colour primaries of the video. For clarity, the value and meanings for Primaries are adopted from Table 2 of ISO/IEC 23091-4 or ITU-T H.273.

element.name: MaxCLL
element.documentation: Maximum brightness of a single pixel (Maximum Content Light Level) in candelas per square meter (cd/m^2^).

element.name: MaxFALL
element.documentation: Maximum brightness of a single full frame (Maximum Frame-Average Light Level) in candelas per square meter (cd/m^2^).

element.name: MasteringMetadata
element.documentation: SMPTE 2086 mastering data.

element.name: PrimaryRChromaticityX
element.documentation: Red X chromaticity coordinate, as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: PrimaryRChromaticityY
element.documentation: Red Y chromaticity coordinate, as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: PrimaryGChromaticityX
element.documentation: Green X chromaticity coordinate, as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: PrimaryGChromaticityY
element.documentation: Green Y chromaticity coordinate, as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: PrimaryBChromaticityX
element.documentation: Blue X chromaticity coordinate, as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: PrimaryBChromaticityY
element.documentation: Blue Y chromaticity coordinate, as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: WhitePointChromaticityX
element.documentation: White X chromaticity coordinate, as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: WhitePointChromaticityY
element.documentation: White Y chromaticity coordinate, as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: LuminanceMax
element.documentation: Maximum luminance. Represented in candelas per square meter (cd/m^2^).

element.name: LuminanceMin
element.documentation: Minimum luminance. Represented in candelas per square meter (cd/m^2^).

element.name: Projection
element.documentation: Describes the video projection details. Used to render spherical, VR videos or flipping videos horizontally/vertically.

element.name: ProjectionType
element.documentation: Describes the projection used for this video track.

element.name: ProjectionPrivate
element.documentation:
Private data that only applies to a specific projection.
* If `ProjectionType` equals 0 (Rectangular), then this element must not be present. * If `ProjectionType` equals 1 (Equirectangular), then this element must be present and contain the same binary data that would be stored inside an ISOBMFF Equirectangular Projection Box ('equi'). * If `ProjectionType` equals 2 (Cubemap), then this element must be present and contain the same binary data that would be stored inside an ISOBMFF Cubemap Projection Box ('cbmp'). * If `ProjectionType` equals 3 (Mesh), then this element must be present and contain the same binary data that would be stored inside an ISOBMFF Mesh Projection Box ('mshp').

ISOBMFF box size and fourcc fields are not included in the binary data, but the FullBox version and flag fields are. This is to avoid redundant framing information while preserving versioning and semantics between the two container formats.

element.name: ProjectionPoseYaw
element.documentation:
Specifies a yaw rotation to the projection.
Value represents a clockwise rotation, in degrees, around the up vector. This rotation must be applied before any `ProjectionPosePitch` or `ProjectionPoseRoll` rotations. The value of this element **MUST** be in the -180 to 180 degree range, both included.
Setting `ProjectionPoseYaw` to 180 or -180 degrees, with the `ProjectionPoseRoll` and `ProjectionPosePitch` set to 0 degrees flips the image horizontally.

element.name: ProjectionPosePitch
element.documentation:
Specifies a pitch rotation to the projection.
Value represents a counter-clockwise rotation, in degrees, around the right vector. This rotation must be applied after the `ProjectionPoseYaw` rotation and before the `ProjectionPoseRoll` rotation. The value of this element **MUST** be in the -90 to 90 degree range, both included.

element.name: ProjectionPoseRoll
element.documentation:
Specifies a roll rotation to the projection.
Value represents a counter-clockwise rotation, in degrees, around the forward vector. This rotation must be applied after the `ProjectionPoseYaw` and `ProjectionPosePitch` rotations. The value of this element **MUST** be in the -180 to 180 degree range, both included.
Setting `ProjectionPoseRoll` to 180 or -180 degrees, the `ProjectionPoseYaw` to 180 or -180 degrees with `ProjectionPosePitch` set to 0 degrees flips the image vertically.
Setting `ProjectionPoseRoll` to 180 or -180 degrees, with the `ProjectionPoseYaw` and `ProjectionPosePitch` set to 0 degrees flips the image horizontally and vertically.

element.name: Audio
element.documentation: Audio settings.

element.name: SamplingFrequency
element.documentation: Sampling frequency in Hz.

element.name: OutputSamplingFrequency
element.documentation: Real output sampling frequency in Hz (used for SBR techniques).
element.implementation_note: The default value for OutputSamplingFrequency of the same TrackEntry is equal to the SamplingFrequency.

element.name: Channels
element.documentation: Numbers of channels in the track.

element.name: ChannelPositions
element.documentation: Table of horizontal angles for each successive channel.

element.name: BitDepth
element.documentation: Bits per sample, mostly used for PCM.

element.name: TrackOperation
element.documentation: Operation that needs to be applied on tracks to create this virtual track. For more details look at (#track-operation).

element.name: TrackCombinePlanes
element.documentation: Contains the list of all video plane tracks that need to be combined to create this 3D track

element.name: TrackPlane
element.documentation: Contains a video plane track that need to be combined to create this 3D track

element.name: TrackPlaneUID
element.documentation: The trackUID number of the track representing the plane.

element.name: TrackPlaneType
element.documentation: The kind of plane this track corresponds to.

element.name: TrackJoinBlocks
element.documentation: Contains the list of all tracks whose Blocks need to be combined to create this virtual track

element.name: TrackJoinUID
element.documentation: The trackUID number of a track whose blocks are used to create this virtual track.

element.name: TrickTrackUID
element.documentation: The TrackUID of the Smooth FF/RW video in the paired EBML structure corresponding to this video track. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: TrickTrackSegmentUID
element.documentation: The SegmentUID of the Segment containing the track identified by TrickTrackUID. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: TrickTrackFlag
element.documentation: Set to 1 if this video track is a Smooth FF/RW track. If set to 1, MasterTrackUID and MasterTrackSegUID should must be present and BlockGroups for this track must contain ReferenceFrame structures. Otherwise, TrickTrackUID and TrickTrackSegUID must be present if this track has a corresponding Smooth FF/RW track. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: TrickMasterTrackUID
element.documentation: The TrackUID of the video track in the paired EBML structure that corresponds to this Smooth FF/RW track. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: TrickMasterTrackSegmentUID
element.documentation: The SegmentUID of the Segment containing the track identified by MasterTrackUID. See [@?DivXTrickTrack].

element.name: ContentEncodings
element.documentation: Settings for several content encoding mechanisms like compression or encryption.

element.name: ContentEncoding
element.documentation: Settings for one content encoding like compression or encryption.

element.name: ContentEncodingOrder
element.documentation: Tells when this modification was used during encoding/muxing starting with 0 and counting upwards. The decoder/demuxer has to start with the highest order number it finds and work its way down. This value has to be unique over all ContentEncodingOrder Elements in the TrackEntry that contains this ContentEncodingOrder element.

element.name: ContentEncodingScope
element.documentation: A bit field that describes which Elements have been modified in this way. Values (big-endian) can be OR'ed.

enum.label: All frame contents, excluding lacing data
The next ContentEncoding (next `ContentEncodingOrder`. Either the data inside `ContentCompression` and/or `ContentEncryption`)

element.name: ContentEncodingType
element.documentation: A value describing what kind of transformation is applied.

element.name: ContentCompression
element.documentation: Settings describing the compression used. This Element **MUST** be present if the value of ContentEncodingType is 0 and absent otherwise. Each block **MUST** be decompressable even if no previous block is available in order not to prevent seeking.

element.name: ContentCompAlgo
element.documentation: The compression algorithm used.

enum.label: zlib
enum.documentation: zlib compression [@!RFC1950].

enum.label: bzlib
enum.documentation: bzip2 compression [@!BZIP2], **SHOULD NOT** be used; see usage notes.

enum.label: lzo1x
enum.documentation: Lempel-Ziv-Oberhumer compression [@!LZO], **SHOULD NOT** be used; see usage notes.

enum.label: Header Stripping
enum.documentation: Octets in `ContentCompSettings` ((#contentcompsettings-element)) have been stripped from each frame.

element.documentation: Compression method "1" (bzlib) and "2" (lzo1x) are lacking proper documentation on the format which limits implementation possibilities. Due to licensing conflicts on commonly available libraries compression methods "2" (lzo1x) does not offer widespread interoperability. Decoding implementations **MAY** support methods "1" and "2" as possible. The use of these compression methods **SHOULD NOT** be used as a default.

element.name: ContentCompSettings
element.documentation: Settings that might be needed by the decompressor. For Header Stripping (`ContentCompAlgo`=3), the bytes that were removed from the beginning of each frames of the track.

element.name: ContentEncryption
element.documentation: Settings describing the encryption used. This Element **MUST** be present if the value of `ContentEncodingType` is 1 (encryption) and **MUST** be ignored otherwise.

element.name: ContentEncAlgo
element.documentation: The encryption algorithm used. The value "0" means that the contents have not been encrypted.

enum.label: DES
enum.documentation: Data Encryption Standard (DES) [@!FIPS.46-3].

enum.label: 3DES
enum.documentation: Triple Data Encryption Algorithm [@!RFC1851].

enum.label: Twofish
enum.documentation: Twofish Encryption Algorithm [@!Twofish].

enum.label: Blowfish
enum.documentation: Blowfish Encryption Algorithm [@!Blowfish].

enum.label: AES
enum.documentation: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) [@!FIPS.197].

element.name: ContentEncKeyID
element.documentation: For public key algorithms this is the ID of the public key the the data was encrypted with.

element.name: ContentEncAESSettings
element.documentation: Settings describing the encryption algorithm used. If `ContentEncAlgo` != 5 this **MUST** be ignored.

element.name: AESSettingsCipherMode
element.documentation: The AES cipher mode used in the encryption.

enum.label: AES-CBC / Cipher Block Chaining, NIST SP 800-38A

element.name: ContentSignature
element.documentation: A cryptographic signature of the contents.

element.name: ContentSigKeyID
element.documentation: This is the ID of the private key the data was signed with.

element.name: ContentSigAlgo
element.documentation: The algorithm used for the signature.

element.name: ContentSigHashAlgo
element.documentation: The hash algorithm used for the signature.

element.name: Cues
element.documentation: A Top-Level Element to speed seeking access. All entries are local to the Segment.
element.implementation_note: This Element **SHOULD** be set when the Segment is not transmitted as a live stream (see #livestreaming).

element.name: CuePoint
element.documentation: Contains all information relative to a seek point in the Segment.

element.name: CueTime
element.documentation: Absolute timestamp according to the Segment time base.

element.name: CueTrackPositions
element.documentation: Contain positions for different tracks corresponding to the timestamp.

element.name: CueTrack
element.documentation: The track for which a position is given.

element.name: CueClusterPosition
element.documentation: The Segment Position of the Cluster containing the associated Block.

element.name: CueRelativePosition
element.documentation: The relative position inside the Cluster of the referenced SimpleBlock or BlockGroup with 0 being the first possible position for an Element inside that Cluster.

element.name: CueDuration
element.documentation: The duration of the block according to the Segment time base. If missing the track's DefaultDuration does not apply and no duration information is available in terms of the cues.

element.name: CueBlockNumber
element.documentation: Number of the Block in the specified Cluster.

element.name: CueCodecState
element.documentation: The Segment Position of the Codec State corresponding to this Cue Element. 0 means that the data is taken from the initial Track Entry.

element.name: CueReference
element.documentation: The Clusters containing the referenced Blocks.

element.name: CueRefTime
element.documentation: Timestamp of the referenced Block.

element.name: CueRefCluster
element.documentation: The Segment Position of the Cluster containing the referenced Block.

element.name: CueRefNumber
element.documentation: Number of the referenced Block of Track X in the specified Cluster.

element.name: CueRefCodecState
element.documentation: The Segment Position of the Codec State corresponding to this referenced Element. 0 means that the data is taken from the initial Track Entry.

element.name: Attachments
element.documentation: Contain attached files.

element.name: AttachedFile
element.documentation: An attached file.

element.name: FileDescription
element.documentation: A human-friendly name for the attached file.

element.name: FileName
element.documentation: Filename of the attached file.

element.name: FileMimeType
element.documentation: MIME type of the file.

element.name: FileData
element.documentation: The data of the file.

element.name: FileUID
element.documentation: Unique ID representing the file, as random as possible.

element.name: FileReferral
element.documentation: A binary value that a track/codec can refer to when the attachment is needed.

element.name: FileUsedStartTime
element.documentation: The timecode at which this optimized font attachment comes into context, based on the Segment TimecodeScale. This element is reserved for future use and if written must be the segment start time. See [@?DivXWorldFonts].

element.name: FileUsedEndTime
element.documentation: The timecode at which this optimized font attachment goes out of context, based on the Segment TimecodeScale. This element is reserved for future use and if written must be the segment end time. See [@?DivXWorldFonts].

element.name: Chapters
element.documentation: A system to define basic menus and partition data. For more detailed information, look at the Chapters explanation in (#chapters).

element.name: EditionEntry
element.documentation: Contains all information about a Segment edition.

element.name: EditionUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the edition. It's useful for tagging an edition.

element.name: EditionFlagHidden
element.documentation: Set to 1 if an edition is hidden. Hidden editions **SHOULD NOT** be available to the user interface (but still to Control Tracks; see (#chapter-flags) on Chapter flags).

element.name: EditionFlagDefault
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the edition **SHOULD** be used as the default one.

element.name: EditionFlagOrdered
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the chapters can be defined multiple times and the order to play them is enforced; see (#editionflagordered).

element.name: ChapterAtom
element.documentation: Contains the atom information to use as the chapter atom (apply to all tracks).

element.name: ChapterUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Chapter.

element.name: ChapterStringUID
element.documentation: A unique string ID to identify the Chapter. Use for WebVTT cue identifier storage [@!WebVTT].

element.name: ChapterTimeStart
element.documentation: Timestamp of the start of Chapter (not scaled).

element.name: ChapterTimeEnd
element.documentation: Timestamp of the end of Chapter (timestamp excluded, not scaled). The value **MUST** be greater than or equal to the `ChapterTimeStart` of the same `ChapterAtom`.
The `ChapterTimeEnd` timestamp value being excluded, it **MUST** take in account the duration of the last frame it includes, especially for the `ChapterAtom` using the last frames of the `Segment`.
element.implementation_note: ChapterTimeEnd **MUST** be set (minOccurs=1) the Edition is an ordered edition; see (#editionflagordered)

element.name: ChapterFlagHidden
element.documentation: Set to 1 if a chapter is hidden. Hidden chapters **SHOULD NOT** be available to the user interface (but still to Control Tracks; see (#chapterflaghidden) on Chapter flags).

element.name: ChapterFlagEnabled
element.documentation: Set to 1 if the chapter is enabled. It can be enabled/disabled by a Control Track. When disabled, the movie **SHOULD** skip all the content between the TimeStart and TimeEnd of this chapter; see (#chapter-flags) on Chapter flags.

element.name: ChapterSegmentUID
element.documentation: The SegmentUID of another Segment to play during this chapter.
The value **MUST NOT** be the `SegmentUID` value of the `Segment` it belongs to.
element.implementation_note: ChapterSegmentUID **MUST** be set (minOccurs=1) if ChapterSegmentEditionUID is used; see (#medium-linking) on medium-linking Segments.

element.name: ChapterSegmentEditionUID
element.documentation: The EditionUID to play from the Segment linked in ChapterSegmentUID. If ChapterSegmentEditionUID is undeclared, then no Edition of the linked Segment is used; see (#medium-linking) on medium-linking Segments.

element.name: ChapterPhysicalEquiv
element.documentation: Specify the physical equivalent of this ChapterAtom like "DVD" (60) or "SIDE" (50); see (#physical-types) for a complete list of values.

element.name: ChapterTrack
element.documentation: List of tracks on which the chapter applies. If this Element is not present, all tracks apply

element.name: ChapterTrackUID
element.documentation: UID of the Track to apply this chapter to. In the absence of a control track, choosing this chapter will select the listed Tracks and deselect unlisted tracks. Absence of this Element indicates that the Chapter **SHOULD** be applied to any currently used Tracks.

element.name: ChapterDisplay
element.documentation: Contains all possible strings to use for the chapter display.

element.name: ChapString
element.documentation: Contains the string to use as the chapter atom.

element.name: ChapLanguage
element.documentation: A language corresponding to the string, in the bibliographic ISO-639-2 form [@!ISO639-2]. This Element **MUST** be ignored if a ChapLanguageIETF Element is used within the same ChapterDisplay Element.

element.name: ChapLanguageIETF
element.documentation: Specifies a language corresponding to the ChapString in the format defined in [@!BCP47] and using the IANA Language Subtag Registry [@!IANALangRegistry]. If a ChapLanguageIETF Element is used, then any ChapLanguage and ChapCountry Elements used in the same ChapterDisplay **MUST** be ignored.

element.name: ChapCountry
element.documentation: A country corresponding to the string, using the same 2 octets country-codes as in Internet domains [@!IANADomains] based on [@!ISO3166-1] alpha-2 codes. This Element **MUST** be ignored if a ChapLanguageIETF Element is used within the same ChapterDisplay Element.

element.name: ChapProcess
element.documentation: Contains all the commands associated to the Atom.

element.name: ChapProcessCodecID
element.documentation: Contains the type of the codec used for the processing. A value of 0 means native Matroska processing (to be defined), a value of 1 means the DVD command set is used; see (#menu-features) on DVD menus. More codec IDs can be added later.

element.name: ChapProcessPrivate
element.documentation: Some optional data attached to the ChapProcessCodecID information. For ChapProcessCodecID = 1, it is the "DVD level" equivalent; see (#menu-features) on DVD menus.

element.name: ChapProcessCommand
element.documentation: Contains all the commands associated to the Atom.

element.name: ChapProcessTime
element.documentation: Defines when the process command **SHOULD** be handled

element.name: ChapProcessData
element.documentation: Contains the command information. The data **SHOULD** be interpreted depending on the ChapProcessCodecID value. For ChapProcessCodecID = 1, the data correspond to the binary DVD cell pre/post commands; see (#menu-features) on DVD menus.

element.name: Tags
element.documentation: Element containing metadata describing Tracks, Editions, Chapters, Attachments, or the Segment as a whole. A list of valid tags can be found in [@!MatroskaTags].

element.name: Tag
element.documentation: A single metadata descriptor.

element.name: Targets
element.documentation: Specifies which other elements the metadata represented by the Tag applies to. If empty or not present, then the Tag describes everything in the Segment.

element.name: TargetTypeValue
element.documentation: A number to indicate the logical level of the target.

enum.label: COLLECTION
enum.documentation: The highest hierarchical level that tags can describe.

enum.label: EDITION / ISSUE / VOLUME / OPUS / SEASON / SEQUEL
enum.documentation: A list of lower levels grouped together.

enum.label: ALBUM / OPERA / CONCERT / MOVIE / EPISODE / CONCERT
enum.documentation: The most common grouping level of music and video (equals to an episode for TV series).

enum.label: PART / SESSION
enum.documentation: When an album or episode has different logical parts.

enum.label: TRACK / SONG / CHAPTER
enum.documentation: The common parts of an album or movie.

enum.label: SUBTRACK / PART / MOVEMENT / SCENE
enum.documentation: Corresponds to parts of a track for audio (like a movement).

enum.label: SHOT
enum.documentation: The lowest hierarchy found in music or movies.

element.name: TargetType
element.documentation: An informational string that can be used to display the logical level of the target like "ALBUM", "TRACK", "MOVIE", "CHAPTER", etc ; see Section 6.4 of [@!MatroskaTags].

element.name: TagTrackUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Track(s) the tags belong to.
If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all tracks in the Segment. If set to any other value, it **MUST** match the `TrackUID` value of a track found in this Segment.

element.name: TagEditionUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the EditionEntry(s) the tags belong to.
If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all editions in the Segment. If set to any other value, it **MUST** match the `EditionUID` value of an edition found in this Segment.

element.name: TagChapterUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Chapter(s) the tags belong to.
If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all chapters in the Segment. If set to any other value, it **MUST** match the `ChapterUID` value of a chapter found in this Segment.

element.name: TagAttachmentUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Attachment(s) the tags belong to.
If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all the attachments in the Segment. If set to any other value, it **MUST** match the `FileUID` value of an attachment found in this Segment.

element.name: SimpleTag
element.documentation: Contains general information about the target.

element.name: TagName
element.documentation: The name of the Tag that is going to be stored.

element.name: TagLanguage
TagLanguageIETF
element.documentation: Specifies the language used in the TagString according to [@!BCP47] and using the IANA Language Subtag Registry [@!IANALangRegistry]. If this Element is used, then any TagLanguage Elements used in the same SimpleTag **MUST** be ignored.

element.name: TagDefault
element.documentation: A boolean value to indicate if this is the default/original language to use for the given tag.

element.name: TagDefaultBogus
element.documentation: A variant of the TagDefault element with a bogus Element ID; see (#tagdefault-element).

element.name: TagString
element.documentation: The value of the Tag.

element.name: TagBinary
element.documentation: The values of the Tag, if it is binary. Note that this cannot be used in the same SimpleTag as TagString.
